title: How to Do Princess Leia Hair

steps.title: Brush your hair, then part it down the middle.
steps.content: Brush your hair, then part it down the middle. Comb through your hair to remove any knots or tangles. Use the handle part of a rat-tail comb to part your hair down the center. Have the part go from your forehead down to the nape of your neck. [1] X Research source This method is great for those who have very long hair, at least to elbow-length.

steps.title: Pull your hair up into two high pigtails.
steps.content: Pull your hair up into two high pigtails. Grab the left side of your hair. Pull it up into a high pigtail, about 1 inch (2.54 centimeters) above your ear. Tie it off with a hair tie that matches your hair color. Repeat the process for the right side of your head. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Twist one pigtail into a rope.
steps.content: Twist one pigtail into a rope. Leave the other pigtail alone for right now. If you want a fancier Leia bun, braid the pigtail instead, then tie the end off with a clear hair elastic.

steps.title: Wrap the rope around the base of the pigtail.
steps.content: Wrap the rope around the base of the pigtail. Tuck the end of your hair under the bun after you coil it. Princess Leia's buns are not like regular buns. Instead, they are coiled in the same fashion as cinnamon buns. This is the effect you are aiming for. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Secure the bun to your head with bobby pins.
steps.content: Secure the bun to your head with bobby pins. You will need a good amount of bobby pins to secure the style, otherwise the bun will fall apart. [4] X Research source Plan on using one bobby pin every inch (2.54 centimeters). Be sure to use something that matches your hair color. You may need to add some pins to the inside of the bun to help hold it together.

steps.title: Repeat the process for the other pigtail.
steps.content: Repeat the process for the other pigtail. Make sure that you wrap your pigtail in the same direction as the first one. For example, if you started wrapping your first pigtail towards the back of you head, you should wrap this one towards the back as well.

steps.title: Repeat the same process for the other bun.
steps.content: Repeat the same process for the other bun. Coil your bun in the same direction as you coiled the first one. This way they will match. For example, if you coiled the first bun away from your face, coil the second one away from your face as well.

steps.title: Spray your hair using hairspray.
steps.content: Spray your hair using hairspray. Now find some fellow rebels to overthrow the Empire with!

steps.title: Brush and part your hair down the middle.
steps.content: Brush and part your hair down the middle. Comb through your hair to remove any knots or tangles. Use the handle of a rat-tail comb to create a neat, even center part, going from your forehead to the nape of your neck. This method works best on hair that's shoulder length.

steps.title: Tie your hair into two high pigtails.
steps.content: Tie your hair into two high pigtails. Gather all your hair on the left side of the part into a high pigtail. Position it about 1 inch (2.54 centimeters) above your ear and secure it with a hair tie that matches your hair color. Do the same thing for the right side of your head. Make sure that the hair going into each pigtail is smooth and neat.

steps.title: Create a set of sock buns.
steps.content: Create a set of sock buns. Find a pair of clean socks that match your hair color. Cut the toes off, then roll each sock from top-to-bottom to form a doughnut shape. The socks need to be long enough to cover your ankle, otherwise your buns will turn out too small.

steps.title: Slip a pigtail through one of the sock buns.
steps.content: Slip a pigtail through one of the sock buns. Pull the entire pigtail through the sock bun first, then bring the bun towards the end of the pigtail. Set the other sock bun off to the side for now.

steps.title: Spread the ends of your hair around the top of the sock bun.
steps.content: Spread the ends of your hair around the top of the sock bun. Try to spread the hair as evenly as possible. Tuck them under the sock bun so that they are nestled between the bun and the body of the pigtail.

steps.title: Use both hands to roll the sock bun towards the base of the pigtail.
steps.content: Use both hands to roll the sock bun towards the base of the pigtail. This step can be tricky, and it may take you a few tries before you get the hang of it. Place your thumbs on the top edges of the sock bun, and your fingers on the bottom edges. Push inward with your fingers and pull outward with your thumbs. This will cause the bun to roll down a notch. Keep going until the bun reaches the hair tie.

steps.title: Secure the sock bun to your head with bobby pins that match your hair color.
steps.content: Secure the sock bun to your head with bobby pins that match your hair color. Plan on using a bobby pin on the top, bottom, and both sides of the sock bun. Use more, if necessary.

steps.title: Repeat the whole process for the other side's sock bun.
steps.content: Repeat the whole process for the other side's sock bun. Check yourself in the mirror to ensure that both buns are the same size and at the same height. Make any adjustments, if needed.

steps.title: Spray the buns lightly with hairspray.
steps.content: Spray the buns lightly with hairspray. Now you are ready to rebel against the Empire and save the galaxy.

steps.title: Brush your hair and pull it into a high ponytail.
steps.content: Brush your hair and pull it into a high ponytail. Secure the ponytail with a hair tie, preferably one that matches your hair color. Make sure that the hair going into the ponytail is smooth. This style works best on longer hair.

steps.title: Split the ponytail in half horizontally.
steps.content: Split the ponytail in half horizontally. You want to have a top section and a bottom section. Use the handle of a rat-tail comb to divide the ponytail, if needed.

steps.title: Pull the top half of the ponytail through a bun maker.
steps.content: Pull the top half of the ponytail through a bun maker. Bring the bun maker all the way down to the base of the ponytail. Clip the hair in the bun maker out of the way for now. Use a large bun maker that matches your hair color. Bun makers look like doughnuts, except that they are made out of a spongy, netted material

steps.title: Braid the bottom half of the ponytail.
steps.content: Braid the bottom half of the ponytail. Split the bottom half of the ponytail into three sections. Cross the left and right sections over the middle one until you reach the end of your hair. Secure the braid with a clear hair elastic. This part of the style is now complete. If you have thin hair, gently tug on the outer loops forming the braid to fluff it up and give it some volume.

steps.title: Spread your hair over the bun maker and secure it with an elastic.
steps.content: Spread your hair over the bun maker and secure it with an elastic. Unclip the upper half of the ponytail. Use your hands to smooth the hair around the bun maker so that it is no longer visible. Slide a clear hair elastic over the bun, pinching the hair underneath it. If you can't cover the bun maker completely with your hair, switch to a smaller size.

steps.title: Split the excess hair into three sections.
steps.content: Split the excess hair into three sections. Your hair will be coming out from under the bun maker after the previous step. Gather all that hair, and pull it towards the back of your head. Split this hair into three sections.

steps.title: Braid each section separately.
steps.content: Braid each section separately. When you are done, you should have three mini braids coming out of the back of your bun. Secure each braid with a clear hair elastic. It might be a good idea to clip the other sections out of the way while you work on the braids.

steps.title: Wrap right braid around the top of the bun and secure it with pins.
steps.content: Wrap right braid around the top of the bun and secure it with pins. Take the right mini braid. Pull it upward and wrap it counterclockwise around the top part of the bun. Make sure that the center of the bun is still visible. Tuck the end of the braid down against the bun, then secure everything with bobby pins. Use bobby pins that match your hair color.

steps.title: Wrap the middle braid around the bun.
steps.content: Wrap the middle braid around the bun. Bring the middle mini braid upward, and wrap it counterclockwise around the bun, just below top braid. Tuck the end down, as before, and secure everything with bobby pins.

steps.title: Wrap the final braid around the base of the bun.
steps.content: Wrap the final braid around the base of the bun. Take the final mini braid. Wrap it counterclockwise around the base of the bun. Try to cover the gap between the middle braid and your head. Tuck the tail under the bun, then secure everything with bobby pins.

steps.title: Set the style with hairspray.
steps.content: Set the style with hairspray. You are now ready to attend important ceremonies and award those who helped you save the galaxy!

steps.title: Brush your hair and create a deep side part.
steps.content: Brush your hair and create a deep side part. It does not matter which side you part your hair on, as long as you made the part deep. It should be level with your eyebrow. [5] X Research source This style will be easier with longer hair, but you can attempt it if you have short hair. It helps to start on your less dominant side.

steps.title: Split the hair at your hairline into three sections.
steps.content: Split the hair at your hairline into three sections. Gather some hair from the thicker side of the part. It should be perpendicular to the part, not parallel to it. Split it into three sections. Each one should be no thicker than your finger. [6] X Research source Use a rat tail comb or your pinky finger and nail to create even sections of hair.

steps.title: Braid for two stitches.
steps.content: Braid for two stitches. Cross the front strand under the middle one, then cross the back strand under the middle one. This will be the start of your Dutch braid. It is very important that you cross the left and right strands under the middle one and not over, otherwise you'll get a French braid instead. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Begin to Dutch braid across your forehead.
steps.content: Begin to Dutch braid across your forehead. Gather some hair from your hairline, and add it to the front section. Cross the front section under the middle one. Gather some hair from just behind the back section. Add it to the back section, then cross it under the middle one. [8] X Research source Keep the braid about an inch (2.54 centimeters) from your hairline.

steps.title: Continue to Dutch braid towards the nape of your neck.
steps.content: Continue to Dutch braid towards the nape of your neck. When you reach the nape of your neck, brush your hair back to hide the part, then continue adding it into the braid as before. Braid across the back of your head, then stop. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Gather the rest of your hair together and do a regular braid.
steps.content: Gather the rest of your hair together and do a regular braid. Pull all the hair from the other side of your head into the Dutch braid. Finish off with a regular braid. Your braid needs to be long enough to wrap around the side of your head and reach just past the part. [10] X Research source If you hair isn't long enough for this, continue Dutch braiding until you reach the part, then finish off with a regular braid.

steps.title: Wrap the braid across the top of your head.
steps.content: Wrap the braid across the top of your head. Keep the braid right against the inside edge of the Dutch braid. Tuck the tail-end of the braid underneath the braid, then secure everything with bobby pins. [11] X Research source Use bobby pins that match your hair color. Depending on your hair length, you may have to wrap the braid a few times around your head. This is perfectly fine; Leia herself had very long hair!

steps.title: Set the style with hairspray.
steps.content: Set the style with hairspray. You are now ready to brave the cold and save your friends from AT-ATs and wampas.
